intro: Gerascanthus bogotensis, commonly known as the Bogotá geranium, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountain meadows. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or humus-rich soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
